	Platform Google meet  Where did you guys find the link resource you were talking about in the career tutorial today  thanks but I was talking about the power point yea sure but he prepare ppt from this i think bro we will post the ppt slides after the session But what was presented was difficult to understand I dont know if it was from my side but i didnt understand what the assignment is Does anyone has an understanding Hi everyone channel Here is the link to the presentation and the exercise guideline   We basically find  real jobs on data engineering based on the guidelines provided and report on our findings and jobs we have seen also based on the guideline provided If that is not clear dm me thanks thanks Great Will dm you after checking the guidelines ok Thank you so much Thank you O ACADEMY BATCH   SLACK WORKSPACE CHANNELS 
Welcome to  Academy slack workspace We will be using this platform to communicate with the trainees and share resources needed throughout the training To have a well organized workspace we have created different channels for specific purposes The following are the list of channels in this workspace and their respective purposes

CUJJLQallbroadcast  This channel will be used for sharing important information and announcements such as weekly schedule session reminders leaderboard and so on Only  Academy team can post on this channel

CTKDGAallcareerexercises This channel will be used for sharing career related issues and exercises Trainees should adopt this channel to ask questions and share resources that are peculiar to Career This channel is open for all trainees

CTAXKKalltechnicalsupport Trainees should adopt this channel to ask questions related to tenx platform google classroom google meet and slack platform

CTPMJKGallresources For easy easy access to resources shared trainees should use this channel to share valuable resources such as books videos articles and so on

CTEQQSNFallweek  This channel is used for asking questions related to week challenge  Academy tutors will be available to answer your questions as fast as possible However trainees can also answer another trainees questions  provided heshe is sure of the answer In addition trainees should answer questions in a thread so that the channel can be organized and other trainees can also benefit from such questions Please note that we will always create a new channel weekly such as allweek allweek and so on

CTAPHXallcommunitybuilding   This group was created with the objective of growing a formidable bond among batch  trainees and  Academy team We will be using this channel for community building sessions social and community building discussions  This channel is open to all trainees


CTBUCUUDrandom   This group is for discussions that are not related to the training such as choice of music politics football and so on

It is imperative to inform all trainees to have mutual respect for fellow trainees and avoid use of offensive words REMINDER  here  UVLHPDME

 Concise text on scaling and normalization

 Little bit of detailed text on scaling and normalization
 understand the math here  this contains python implementation of PCA and code in git hub and colab   One of my favourite analogies is the one used to describe Zero Knowledge Proofs
Normally if you want to send a crypto asset say Bitcoin the network would first verify if you have the said amount of Bitcoin in the first place But for privacy conscious users of blockchain Zero Knowledge Proof provide a cryptographic proof of ownership without revealing too much information to the network
Though a zeroknowledge proof is a sophisticated method of authenticating a transaction without revealing much details about it the analogy below breaks down its most basic function

Lets say UUUMMYH is colourblind but doesnt know it Now UUKGSDGSG needs to proof to Yasabneh that theres a difference between green and red She gives Yasabneh two snooker balls one green and one red but they are otherwise identical

Yasabneh couldnt see the difference and hes pretty skeptical To verify Hermelas claim that they are indeed different in colour he device a proof system

Yasabneh holds one snooker ball in each hand and put them behind his back He either switches the balls or just leaves them be

Theres an equal chance of switching and not switching He then brings them out from his back Hermela now has to guess whether Yasabneh switched the balls or not She can know with certainty whether Yasabneh switched the balls just by looking at the colours because shes not colourblind

If she had lied and the balls were of the same colour then she only has  probability of guessing the switches correctly So one try wouldnt be enough to get Yasabneh convinced Yasabneh and Hermela then go ahead to repeat this proof multiple times

With each time Hermela gets it right the chance it was just plan luck goes away Yasabneh eventually is convinced that the balls are of different colours

The proof is zeroknowledge because Yasabneh never learns which ball is green and which one is red He just knows theyre different colours Very helpful when you try to scale features the thing is you can only scale numerical features Therefore you need to transform your categorical object string features into numbers And that is where this link would become very useful I hope you will use it

having just jupyter notebooks to having a dashboard Whats is the very first step to take You can start making visualizations or loading your models and make predictions OK here goes

 Is to actually know or plan what you want to visualize or show on your dashboard Usually almost all the things I did for myself
 Next you install stream lit or your desired mode of visualizer modules like Heroku I prefer stream lit because I never really worked with Heroku
 After installing everything you then use all your prewritten scripts here for your advantage Meaning you can directly use all the methods and helper functions you have already written for your dashboard demonstration Especially all your data visualization scripts
 Then you will create a python file or files containing the streamlit module to do the dashboard At this point it all comes to using the streamlit module to make and show your dashboard You dont have to exactly show each and everything as you did in your notebook You can make many other kinds of visualization in streamlit
 Finally after you completed what you want to show using your python file or files you then can just use the official streamlit website to host your demonstrations publicly

 its like dvcapiget_url is not working How tho change the version of my data when running the code I definitely caused some confusion so to clear things up 

From a fresh setup you start off with these commands by initializing a git and a DVC repository
git init
dvc init
git commit m initial commit
You then follow on to set the DVC remote  this is the MOST crucial step and should be done first because messing with different remotes and then tracking the changes on multiple unsynchronized remotes will lead to unnecessary complications as we saw
dvc remote add d myremote gdrivefolderid
git commit m sets dvc remote
the remote URL can be in your local file system but using google drive will be really helpful for collaboration as you are working in teams Please follow this  to learn more

After this will follow the steps where you will actually track the data
dvc add path_to_data
git add path_to_datadvc
git commit m datatrack
You then tag the specific commit and then push it to your DVC remote using dvc push
git tag a v m raw data
dvc push
The final two steps are the only steps that are necessary and the steps youll iterate over and over once DVC and your DVC remote are set and you start making changes to your data So if youve changed your remote and then are trying to go back and get a tagged version of your data using dvcapiget_url that will lead to the data URL being in a previous remote If you have set multiple remotes and are sure the data is there try adding the remote argument
data_url  dvcapiget_url
    path  path
    repo  repo
    rev  version
    remote  remotename

Q  Tell me about yourself  minutes
Q  How did you get to your current status as a MLEng DataEng
Q  Take me through a project that you are proud of
Q   questions that you would ask them for the rolecompany

For Q  forget the job tell them about you to start Give them a why if you have one What is important to you
 Your name in  full
 Where you live
 What you are doing right now
 What your university education was  which course Mention notable courses and projects Mention challenges as well if any
 Link to  Academy  why did you apply How does it link to your future goals
 Overview of what you learned at  Academy Sprinkle in keywords on technologies that you have used Look at the list of expertise keywords in the careers doc
 You dont need to close it off with a hire me  its one part of the discussion
 You should feel free to talk about things that you like Your parents kids cats neighboursetc
Its a summary of who you are and where you come from

For Q  Your background in MLEng and Data Eng
 Start with your university  which courses did you take that were relevant
 Highlight your math and your algorithms and other related courses
 Talk about student projects or internships that were relevant  mention them in the frame of MLEng or DEng  what aspects of them were related
 Talk about  Academy and highlight  key projects that you are proud of and which could be related to what the employer is interested in If the job is NLP talk about Speech to Text and especially the processing part  If the job is ETL talk about your pipeline buliding
 Talk about any selflearning including which resources you used
 Give a summary of your background at the end as it relates to the whole stack So that you have some background in Data Eng you have worked on different models you have deep expertise in Python and SQL you have done some CICD and ML DevOps visualization and reporting Tie it together and show that you know where your expertise fits in the overall context
Q  Be ready to walk them through a project that is relevant in a lot of detail
 Have your notebook clean and ready to present and walk though
 Be ready to explain approaches you took
 Be ready to explain why you chose one approach over other approaches
 Be ready to talk about things that you realize you didnt do as well as you could have
 Be ready to talk about things that you would have implemented given the time
 Be ready to talk about where you would take the project next
Q  Prepare questions for the company and the role
 This is one of the most important things  its your opportunity to showcase the type of thinker that you are
 Ask meaningful questions that you would be likely to ask if you started work and it was Day

I think of it like this

Kitchens in a restaurant serving hundreds of people
 Data Scientists are the head chefs figuring out the recipes that people want to eat and which fit the budget
 ML Engineers do the cooking for people at scale  They use the ingredients from DEng and the recipes from DSci
 Data Engineers ensure that all the ingredients are coming into the kitchen prepared and ready  No ingredients no food Choosing good quality ingredients and preparing them well is hard
 MLOps folks build and maintain the kitchen infrastructure stoves ovens etc

channel Having received a number of complaints or clarity about leaderboard scores its imperative to give a detailed explanation on how leaderboard scores are calculated 

It is essential to note that the following components constitute your leaderboard scores 
 Technical submission 
 Nontechnical submission 
 Standup and tutorial attendance 
 Slack participation 
There are standard scores for each of these components On the leaderboard section of tenx we have week score and previous week score  your week score is the cumulative of all previous weeks including the present week For example the week score  of the week  leaderboard is the cumulative of week to week not week  alone You can also view this example like the grading system of university CGPA Consequently your previous weeks scores will affect all your new scores

If you have any further question you can kindly reach out to me Do have a restful weekend and a great month ahead  Community Building Session REMINDERtimer_clock here

PLEASE DO NOT PURSUE THIS APPROACH  Our guidance on tracks is based on our experience of what employers are looking for  Its highly unlikely though not impossible that one can fit  years of experience into  months of selflearning Yep But there will be new ones by then Its about getting into the real world of what people are writing Super  One down Get ready for  more It isnt personal it isnt even professional  its just part of the system Train your mind to trust the process It will take months of dedicated effort but we will get there together And yes there will be many rejection emails Rejection emails are a step better than just not hearing anything back I read all the submissions  there are essentially three groups
 Practical and dispassionate approaches to solving the problem of getting a first job  They know that once they get their first job and experience the world will open up to them  These people focus on optimizing for one job and for being ready for getting it in  months
 Confused people who arent sure which way to go  I assume that these people worry about their future instead of focussing on one thing only getting the first job  Id love to chat openly with these people to help them make a good first choice
 Dreamers who hope that because of passion and superhuman effort they will beat the system  Those who aim to doublejump the twin gaps of first globallevel job and getting a job in a field that they dont have the requisite experience for  Most of this group wants to go for an ML Eng role without SWEng experience  To this group I would ask What would you rather be doing this time next year  a globallevel DE job or a local ML job  I feel like those are your two choices                  Hello I am struggling to upload my presentation and report but cant yet What  could be the problem UTEPYRMP Size of file limited UUDBULCL You can check your network Try to close the classroom and try again  UUGYHAUT Watch your dancing video rolling_on_the_floor_laughing  UUGJPC why mejoy joy I just relate that with the musics before the stand up timerolling_on_the_floor_laughing Let me send you another one  wait rolling_on_the_floor_laughing rolling_on_the_floor_laughingrolling_on_the_floor_laughing I just found it You think its worth reading Wouldnt it bias you Big proof  I think its worth reading man  Is this your new quake book joy For all my Stans out there Do you remember these times

you were at one of the art galleriesgrin selling your art for a million bucks haha Thats True Brother grin UVAMTFA  to add this special badge of empathy for week  badges a winner is known already Good morning here Good Morning Emillien Good morning Good morning  Good Morning morning  Goo morning Arun oops wrong channel  hello I cant get access to our group aws instance since yesterday whats the reason UUKLBR UUPVQ  UUDRQH its down AWS is   we take them down postchallenge Happy to spin the instance back up for you for  Birr Good morning winners welcome to week  of week  of this intensive training We commend your resilience and perseverance as you sail through the thick and thin of this training Youve been pushing since the day you applied for this training and you never cease to push to get your tasks done We are proud of you Youve started seeing some rays of light inside the tunnel  in the coming weeks youll eventually see the light at the end of the tunnel Do have a great week ahead blush If you struggle with procrastination these  tips below can help you make progress and stay on track Remember sometimes being aware of the problem can help you take steps to overcome it
 Set small goals The thought of completing one huge task can seem daunting Having a list of small and achievable goals can help you tackle each one in turn meaning that you make gradual progress towards completion
 Organize your tasks The point above feeds into this one You can stay motivated to accomplish your main goals by creating a precise schedule with dates daily weekly and monthly for when you will achieve each of your smaller goals
  Focus your attention Concentrating on some of the simpler activities you need to complete is another method for overcoming procrastination This is a major confidence booster to achieve set tasks
 Remove distractions They can easily derail your progress whether its having your phone next to you on your desk or having the TV on in the background Ensure you create a comfortable working environment where distractions cant thrive
 Forgive yourself Its easy to punish yourself for putting off tasks You might tell yourself that youre being ineffective or lazy In actuality doing this to yourself doesnt increase productivity it just makes you feel more agitated and nervous So learn to forgive yourself always

NB When you create your private channel ensure youve added at least one member of the tutoring team Yabebal Yididya Azaria Nardos and I  Task Variants

Semantic Segmentation
Semantic Segmentation is the task of segmenting parts of an image that belong to the same class Semantic Segmentation models make predictions for each pixel and return the probabilities of the classes for each pixel These models are evaluated on Mean Intersection Over Union Mean IoU

Instance Segmentation
Instance Segmentation is the variant of Image Segmentation where every distinct object is segmented instead of one segment per class

Panoptic Segmentation
Panoptic Segmentation is the Image Segmentation task that segments the image both by instance and by class assigning each pixel a different instance of the class  We dont despair of a goal because were not perfect Epictetus said We strive to get closer to it each day We strive to get better each day This as Marcus might have written to himself is your reminder I like this reminder UUVHCVKB   This guy is just insaneeyes grinningface_with_raised_eyebrowface_with_raised_eyebrow

UUJKJGRAQ I think I cannot present since UUGHTV said he took the logo and cta I think Mohamed should present the logo and CTA Henok You should skip this presentation Challenges 
  Logo detection and button positioning was the most challenging part and the fact that its also global issue companies like Amazon faced the same issue and they invested on teams andbuilt huge  infrastructure for over coming this problem
 The challeng was all the available solutions work as API and we cant risk our sensitive data to be sent to third parties also the available models need to be trained on large amount of data to solve the issue besided it will cost time and money to do that 
Proposed solution
 We used a creative way that maixmize the quality of results while minimizing the cost 
 We used template matching method wich is available in OpenCv library
 We gave the model a picture of the logo and aske it to locae its position on the image
 We extracted the Starting coordination  points of the logo in the image plus the hight and the width of it
 The result was more than  of the logo positions was detected and more than  of engagement buttons was detecte also
Future recommendations 
 Train our own model to get accurate results
 We should use Yolo  as a model

Orisos Swett Marden Good view  Author Rebecca Solnit on growing whole rather than growing up

Growing up we say as though we were trees as though altitude was all that there was to be gained but so much of the process is growing whole as the fragments are gathered the patterns found Human infants are born with craniums made up of four plates that have not yet knit together into a solid dome so that their heads can compress to fit through the birth canal so that the brain within can then expand The seams of these plates are intricate like fingers interlaced like the meander of arctic rivers across the tundra

The skull quadruples in size in the first few years and if the bones knit together too soon they restrict the growth of the brain and if they dont knit at all the brain remains unprotected Open enough to grow and closed enough to hold together is what life must also be We collage ourselves into being finding the pieces of a worldview and people to love and reasons to live and then integrate them into a whole a life consistent with its beliefs and desires at least if were lucky You African telecomms data All right thanks Hello channel here we are with the last contest of the training Todays contest will be a bit longer and more challenging  focused on problemsolving skills and thinking out of the box
